SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.DISTRIBUTOR: American Sign Language Linguistic Research Project, Boston University, Boston, MA.
SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.AUTHOR: Sarah Fish, Robert G. Lee, Fran Conlin, Mike Schlang, and Carol Neidle. The data have been transcribed at Boston University under the supervision of C. Neidle. We gratefully acknowledge assistance from Lana Cook and Carla DaSilva.
SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.CITATION: Fish, S., R.G. Lee, F. Conlin, M. Schlang, and C. Neidle (2003), ASLLRP Dataset NCSLGR 10a, version 1.1, American Sign Language Linguistic Research Project, Boston University, Boston, MA.
SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.NOTES: Partial funding for this project was provided by the National Science Foundation: grants BCS-9729101, EIA-9809340, and IIS-9912573 to Boston University. The transcriptions are based on ASLLRP Annotation Schema, version 2.5 (see http://www.bu.edu/asllrp/reports.html#rpt11).

PARTICIPANT.NAME: Benjamin James Bahan
PARTICIPANT.LABEL: Ben
PARTICIPANT.PARENTS: Deaf Parents: Mother (Eleanor Westervelt) educated at NJSD (graduated 1941). Father (James V. Bahan) educated at PS 47 (NYC) and Fanwood (graduated 1940).
PARTICIPANT.BACKGROUND: Education: MKSD (formerly known as NJSD), graduated 1974; Gallaudet University, graduated 1978; Boston University, Ph.D. 1996.

TRACK.A: When did John finish reading the book?
When did John finish reading the book?
John has not yet finished reading the book.
When will John finish reading the book?
When will John finish reading the book?
Has John finished reading the book?
Did John finish reading the book?
That book there, John (already) read it yesterday.
After class, John read the book.
If the teacher requires it, John will read the book.
Did John read the book? Yes, he already did.
What is John reading a book about?
What is John reading a book about?
What is John reading a book about?
If John needs more information, he will read the book.
If John reads the book, he will know more about Lincoln's life.
If John reads the book, he will know more about Lincoln's life.
When John finds out there will be a test, he will panic and be compelled to read the book.
When the teacher gives out the test, John will read the book.
The student's father bought a house.
The student's mother bought a car.
The student will buy his/her mother's car.
Which house will the student's father buy?
Mother plans to read that book.
Has mother already read that book?
Why should father buy that book?
Mother should not have bought a car.
Why should mother buy a car?
As for John's car, I've never seen (it).
That (right over there) is John's car.
That (right over there) is John's father's car.
Father MUST give the car to John.
John's father must give a car to Mary.
John should give (his) father a car.
John will give (his) father a car.
Mother will not buy a house.
